title: Millions of 'just managing' families are on the EDGE of poverty - report warns
text: Millions of 'just managing' families are on the EDGE of poverty - report warns Millions of 'just managing' families are on the EDGE of poverty - report warns MILLIONS of families who are "just about managing" are on the tipping point of falling into poverty, a new report warns. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01,   Millions of 'just managing' families are on the edge of poverty The Joseph Rowntree Foundation said the number of people living below an adequate standard of living had increased by four million to 19 million over the past six years. The increase has been driven by rising living costs, while incomes have stagnated, research found. The price of a minimum "basket of goods" has jumped by up to 30% since 2008, but average earnings have only gone up by half that amount, said the report. Related articles Struggling households urged to ACT NOW to beat April water bill RISES Record employment is not enough to help families reach a so-called minimum income standard - calculated by the Centre for Research in Social Policy on what households need to have an acceptable standard of living. Campbell Robb, chief executive of the Joseph Rowntree Foundation, said: "These stark figures show just how precarious life can be for many families. GETTY The price of a minimum 'basket of goods' has jumped by up to 30% since 2008 "Government focus on people on modest incomes is welcome, but it cannot be at the expense of those at the poorest end of the income scale. It must remember just about managing today can become poverty tomorrow. These stark figures show just how precarious life can be for many families Campbell Robb "This could be a very difficult time for just managing families as rising inflation begins to bite into finely balanced budgets. "The high cost of living has already helped push four million more people below an adequate income, and if the cost of essentials such as food, energy and housing rise further, we need to take action to ease the strain.
